column2: So you're Adol... Well,\nit's good to finally meet\nyou.
column3: 亚特鲁吗...\n好吧，请多多指教。

column2: Hmm? What's wrong? Did\nyou need something?
column3: 嗯？怎么啦？\n找我有什么事吗？

column2:
One of our jobs is to
escort people between
places like Minea and
Zepik Village.
column3: 自卫队的工作之一\n是护送本地人到\n米内亚或塞皮克村...

column2:
The monsters tend to avoid me, yet
always attack the villagers I'm
escorting, from behind, without
fail. Cunning bastards...
column3:
有时候魔物偏偏不找我，
专挑后面被护送的人，
找弱的人下手。
都是堆狡滑到令人害怕的家伙。

column2:
I guess the only way to
protect others is by
putting yourself between
them and the enemy.
column3: 保护他人的要诀是\n随时保持在敌人与自己人中间的那个位置。

column2:
They're wily ones, though. When
you're outside the town, be sure
you don't let your guard down for
even a single instant!
column3: 总之那些家伙很狡滑就对了。\n到了城镇以外的地方，绝不能露出半点破绽。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>

We watch the surrounding area from
here. That way, if the demons try
to mount an attack, we can see them
coming and get ready for it.
column3: 从这里可以监视城外的情况。\n魔物妄图入侵时，\n一眼就看出来了。

column2:
I doubt they'll attack
during the day, of course,
but 'tis better to be safe
than sorry...you know?
column3: 我想那些魔物\n是不大可能大白天就来偷袭，不过...\n总之绝不以大意轻敌。

column2:
It's tedious work, but
SOMEBODY has to keep
watch over the city. And
that somebody is me!
column3: 虽然无聊，但是为了城里的安全，\n总得有人来做这份工作嘛。\n...片刻都不能大意哦。

column2:
The monsters pretty much never hit
us here. But the fact remains, they
easily COULD. You can never tell
what they're thinking!
column3:
最近没有发生魔物的袭击。
可是只要我们一放松，
它们又会看准机会打过来...
就好像背后有人在操纵一样。

column2:
Our little port town isn't behind
walls like Minea, so it falls on us
to keep the place safe. In a sense,
it's like WE'RE Barbado's walls.
column3: 本地没有像米内亚那样的城墙，\n所以就得靠我们的自卫队来保护了。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
I came here because I heard\nI could make a tidy profit\nin the local silver trade.
column3: 唉，我是听说这里的银矿很赚钱，\n才专程跑来这个边境地带的说。

column2: Now I just want to go home. Damned\nStormwall! May its stormy progeny\nall suffer uncomfortable bloating!
column3: 好想赶快回大陆哦。\n要不是有可恨的什么结界...

column2: You're from the mainland\nas well, aren't you? What\nbrings you to Esteria?
column3: 你也是从大陆来的人吧？\n你是来艾斯塔里亚做什么的呀？

column2: Do you know Pim, the barterer?\nHe came here around the same\ntime I did.
column3: 你知道米内亚的商人皮姆吗\n那家伙跟我差不多同一时候\n来艾斯塔里亚的。

column2: He's a shady one. Has to be, though,\nworkin' a place like that. Gotta\ncheck your scruples at the door.
column3:
听说他在那里很吃得开，
想也知道他背地里不知干了多少肮脏事。
要不然，
开交换所怎么可能赚钱呢。

column2: At any rate, there's no way back to\nthe mainland right now. So I'm stuck\nhere, selling crap to the locals!
column3: 啊...到底有没有\n可以让我们回去大陆的方法呢...

column2: <!empty>

At one time, Barbado was swimming
in traders like my husband. But
they all tried to go home, and got
swallowed up by the storms.
column3:
以前巴尔巴多
还有很多像我们一样的商人。
大家搭船想逃离这里，
结果都被暴风雨吞没...

column2:
I'm just grateful to have
my family here with me,
though. That's enough to
keep me happy.
column3: 我是因为携家带眷的关系，\n行动慢人一步，没想到\n反而因此保住了一命。

column2: You're going to Minea, no?\nBe careful of the monsters\nwandering the plains.
column3: 你要去米内亚？\n那你得小心草原上的魔物哦。

column2:
My husband does prattle on, doesn't
he? Maybe if he'd join the militia,
or take up fishing, he could work
out some of his anxiety.
column3:
我老公真是的，
就只会在那里怨天尤人...
他要嘛加入自卫队，要嘛去捕鱼
活动活动身体都好。

column2: I need to look for\nsomething I can do to\nhelp around here, myself!
column3: 我也去找找看有没有我能做的\n对镇上有益的事情...

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>

My daddy always talks about
leaving Esteria. But why
would I leave, when I have
so many good friends here?
column3: 爸爸经常在说要离开这个国家。\n可是我一点也不想回去。\n我好不容易在这里交了朋友...。

column2: Ahhh... I think I'm gonna\ngo play with my friend\nnext door!
column3: 啊，我去找邻居的小孩玩。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
My son and his wife live\nin Minea.
column3: 我儿子跟媳妇\n都住在米内亚城内。

column2:
They keep asking me to go live with
them...but they must be joking! This
is my home. I could never leave
here, no matter what the danger!
column3:
他们要我一起去住...
开什么玩笑，
我是打死、
都不会想离开这里的。

column2: At my age, I've no intention of\nfinding a new home.
column3: 都活到这个年纪了，我是不可能\n离开这住惯了的老家的。

column2: I was born and raised here.
column3: 我可是在这里出生、\n在这村长大的呀。

column2: I hope my son and his wife\nare doing well in Minea.
column3: 我那住在米内亚的\n儿子跟媳妇不知道好不好...

column2:
I would like to be able to sneak
away to see my grandchild...but
traveling these monster-infested
roads is far too dangerous!
column3: 我的孙子正值淘气的年纪，\n没有一直在旁看着...\n搞不好会偷溜出城去呀。真是令人担心。

column2: I'm sure my family's doing\nwell...but I still worry\nabout my dear grandchild.
column3: 希望他们都身体健康。\n...只是，对孙子的事我还是不大放心。

column2: <!empty>
Slaff is working hard to keep\nthe town safe...but in the end,\nhe may just be kidding himself.
column3: 虽然斯拉夫常常在训练，\n可是临时抱佛脚也没用啊...

column2:
Rather than live in fear of a
monster attack, wouldn't it be
better for everyone in Barbado
to move to Minea?
column3: 与其在魔物入侵的威胁下生活，\n还不如乾脆全巴尔巴多的人\n都移民到米内亚去会比较好吧？

column2: However hard we try, we're\nsimply no match for the monsters.\nIf they attack us, we're done for!
column3: 不管再怎样努力练功，\n我看都很难打赢魔物...

column2:
You should try to talk some
sense into that stubborn fool.
With mesmerizing hair like yours,
maybe he'd listen!
column3: 你也是同样的想法对吧？

column2: You went to Minea? Are you daft?!\nThere are monsters everywhere!
column3: 你说你去过米内亚了？\n你...你不怕魔物吗？

column2: There was once a village near the\nmine, but I hear it was razed to\nthe ground by the monsters.
column3: 矿山附近的村子\n就是被魔物消灭的啊...

column2: How is that you and Slaff can\nbe such brave men? Do you just\neat a lot of fiber, or what?!
column3: 不管是你还是斯拉夫...\n真搞不懂为什么你们能够那么有信心？

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>

This is the town where I was
born and raised. It's my home!
To even consider leaving this
place...
column3: 这里是我出生、成长的地方...\n可能的话我不想移民到外地去。

column2:
But my child's safety is
paramount. So perhaps
Minea, with its city wall,
really is the place to be!
column3: 但是为了家里的孩子...\n或许住在有城墙的米内亚\n会比较安全吧？

column2:
Our Danny certainly wants to go to
Minea. He's already tried to make
the journey, in fact...with the
neighbor's little girl in tow!
column3: 我儿子真是的，\n竟然想带着邻居家的女孩\n到米内亚去。

column2:
We always warn them how dangerous
it is outside the town... Well,
let me tell you, they got what was
coming to them!
column3: 再三跟他叮咛过\n城外面很危险的...。\n等他回家我一定要好好的骂他一顿。

column2: <!empty>
Hey Mister, did you come\nfrom the mainland? Isn't\nthe Stormwall really neato?!
column3: 大哥哥你是从外面来的吗？\n岚之结界是不是很可怕呀？

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>

I hope it stays forever! If
it ever goes away, the girl
next door will have to leave
with her family.
column3: 我比较希望结界不要消失。\n消失的话，邻居家的女孩就得跟家里的人\n搭船回去家乡了。

column2: Three cheers for the Stormwall!\nIt's what got me my girlfriend!
column3: ...结界\n要是不会消失就好了...

column2: These little critters are called\npikkards. They've been raised as\nlivestock here for generations.
column3: 这只叫做皮卡多。\n自古以来这个国家的人所饲养的家畜。

column2: <!empty>

Their meat is absolutely delicious,
but they're real easy prey for
monsters. So we raise 'em here,
where nothing can hurt 'em but us!
column3: 肉质非常棒，美味极了。\n因为会成为魔物的猎物，\n所以就这样圈在城里面养了。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
Since the ships are all grounded,\nthere's no work to be had at the\nharbor anymore.
column3: 自从船只不能通航以后，\n港口的工作机会就全部没了。

column2: <!empty>

I'd been hoping to branch out
into the silver trade...but
that didn't exactly work out
either. Bad luck, all around!
column3: 之前我们都是靠银矿交易在过活的，\n偏偏在打算扩大营业的时候...。\n...太遗憾了。

column2: *sigh* Guess it's a fisherman's\nlife for me!
column3: 啊，到底该怎么办呢。\n...难道只剩捕鱼一途了吗。\n

column2: <!empty>
Watch out for the blue-headed\ndemons out in the field. Be\ncareless, and you'll be dead.
column3: 在草原要注意青脑袋的魔物。\n还没有习惯作战之前，\n很难把它打伤。

column2:
You're only human, after all.
If you're not sure about your
chances for survival...then
run away! Run like the wind!
column3: 留得青山在不怕没柴烧，\n见情况不妙的时候别意气用事，赶快逃。

column2:
Slaff should ease up a bit,
and stop worrying. If things
get hectic, everyone here can
always just move to Minea.
column3:
斯拉夫也真是的，
何必那么紧张呢。
情况不妙时，大家全部
逃到米内亚避难就好了嘛。

column2:
I love this town...but would I die
for it? Hell no! Rastin's villagers
made that mistake, and I do NOT
intend to end up like they did!
column3: 我是在这地方住习惯了啦，不过...\n我可不想步上拉斯提尼村的后尘。

column2: Word on the street is that\nMinea's having a real problem\nwith thieves these days...
column3: 不过现在谣传米内亚\n正饱受盗贼之害...

column2: Thieves and monsters...\nImagine having to contend\nwith both at the same time!
column3: 魔物跟盗贼吗...\n任何一边都很麻烦呀...

column2: <!empty>

Things were great six months
ago. Huge trade ships were
coming in constantly, and
Barbado was flourishing.
column3: 半年前还是那么美好的呀...\n大商船接二连三的开来，\n那时巴尔巴多港可是热闹极了。

column2: But these days, all we do is\nfish, fish, fish. I yearn for\nthe way things were...
column3: 如今却成了普通的渔村...\n真怀念那个时候啊。

column2:
*sigh* I'm not sure this town can
survive on fishing alone. It's only
been six months, and we're already
in a pretty bad way...
column3: 呼...\n短短半年就变成原来的渔村...\n感觉好空虚啊。

column2:
I wonder what caused the
Stormwall... If we knew
that, we might be able to
get rid of it!
column3: 岚之结界的形成原因是什么呢？\n我想要是查得出来，\n这个国家就能恢复原来的样子了。

column2: <!empty>
Six months ago, monsters started\nshowing up on the north road.
column3: 大约半年前，北边的街道\n开始有魔物出没。

column2:
As a result, I haven't seen
my friends in Minea for quite
some time. I wonder how they're
doing these days...
column3: 害我有好一阵子都没办法\n去见米内亚的朋友。\n他们现在不知道怎么样了...

column2: Minea's protected by city walls,\nso it's a safer place to be.
column3: 米内亚有坚固的城墙，\n我想是比这里安全。

column2: On the other hand, I hear they\nhave some serious crime problems\nthere. Lots of thievery...
column3: 不过现在又有风声说\n米内亚频频遭到盗贼骚扰...

column2: You know what? I trust our militia.\nThey look after us, Minea, and even\nZepik! They're good people.
column3: 还是自卫队比较可靠啊。\n会护送民众到\n米内亚或塞皮克村。

column2: But we can't just take them for\ngranted. I mean, you just never\nknow, right?
column3: 不过也不能突然就开口要他们帮忙。\n那样做不大好吧？

column2:
But just between you and me...
I feel like the men here tend to
perpetuate violence just to satisfy
their own sense of machismo!
column3: 这话我只跟你说哦...\n你不觉得看到男人\n为自己冒生命危险...

column2:
Though, I dunno, I actually...kinda
like that! Big, strong, supple men
fighting to keep me from harm...
It's really pretty sexy!
column3: 内心有点高兴吗。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
Well, now, who might you be?
column3: 哦，你不是本地人哦...

column2: I see, so you're the young man that\nDr. Bludo has been looking after...\nYou must've been through a lot!
column3: 是吗，原来你是被送去布鲁多医生\n那里的年轻人啊...\n发生海难真是不幸啊

column2: <!empty>
But you're looking very well.\nThat's Bludo for you!
column3: 不过看你好像很健康的样子，\n这应该是布鲁多医生的治疗的功劳吧。

column2:
There's a fortuneteller who
lives in #02Minea#00, to the north.
She predicted the Stormwall,
the monsters...everything!
column3: 北#02米内亚街道#00的占卜师\n对于岚之结界与魔物的出现，\n好像做过很多预言的样子...

column2:
If there's something you need to
know, you should go visit her.
She'll answer every question you
could possibly have!
column3: 如果你有什么事情想要知道，\n去拜访一下那位占卜师怎样？

column2: ...Once you're feeling up to it,\nthat is. Don't want your wounds\nreopening, after all!
column3: 不过那是等你的\n身体恢复过来再说的事了。
